data.text: @jmwooldridge U might want to try out earbud type earphones because they basically cannot break.
@jmwooldridge These ones get rather loud. I'm not sure if they're loud enough for you not to need the hearing aids, but they're definitely loud enough to annoy people around you! 😅
@AlfredoPaloyo That looks nice! My guess is that I’d have to wear my (old) hearing aids. A benefit of headphones is I don’t.
@jmwooldridge Just buy a speakerphone, Jeff. The Jabra Speak series has models at multiple price points. https://t.co/YVLWsMhGHT

@jmwooldridge They're also very nice for active transport, like biking. At first I was apprehensive, but the Transparency setting combined with low volume produces a safe, full awareness bike ride with a little music too. Even when I look like a pro wrestler from the 1980s with pandemic hair
@jmwooldridge Bose headphones are sturdy and provide great unmatchable sound quality. Sharing personal experience.
@jmwooldridge I am not sure your sample is big enough for such an inference. But you are the expert, I mean..

@RyanDEdwards Headphones serve a dual purpose on bad hair days -- or, in my case, little hair days. 

I was recently given a pair of AirPods Pro so I think I'll try them ....
@jmwooldridge Don't buy cheap headsets. Buy some seinnheiser wireless headphones. I have a few that have lasted for a few years. They're great and very resistants.
@jmwooldridge Apple AirPods Pro are fantastic. Easy to lose, and the batteries may go soon, but I love mine
